gui

Class Wizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractRobotDriver
      • gui.Wizard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotDriver

    public class Wizard
extends AbstractRobotDriver
    The Wizard class has full knowledge of the maze in which it operates and uses this to its advantage.
    Author:
    Elijah Mas

      • basicWalk

        private boolean basicWalk()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Walk through every operation specified by the opQueue queue. Includes rotations and moves.
        Returns:
        true if the walk is successful, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the robot encounters an error along the way

      • setMaze

        public void setMaze(Maze maze)
        Set maze and dimensions.
        Parameters:
        maze - a Maze instance

      • triggerUpdateSensorInformation

        public void triggerUpdateSensorInformation()
        Not implemented: the Wizard class has access to full maze data, so there is no need to rely on sensors. This method purposely does nothing.
        Specified by:
        triggerUpdateSensorInformation in interface RobotDriver
        Overrides:
        triggerUpdateSensorInformation in class AbstractRobotDriver

      • drive2Exit

        public boolean drive2Exit()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Construct the series of operations to be performed on the robot, and then perform them all.
        Specified by:
        drive2Exit in interface RobotDriver
        Overrides:
        drive2Exit in class AbstractRobotDriver
        Returns:
        whether the robot has left the maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
